result.execSummary:
The defendant Elijah S Gallien was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay a fine of $100.00 plus all applicable court costs by 11-14-2016 or the nonpayment penalty will be entry of a civil judgment.

with credit for 1 day.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

***Court will consider motion for expungement in 1 year if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law.***

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elijah S Gallien

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court will consider motion for expungement in 1 year if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court ordered defendant to serve 1 day in the House of Correction, with 1 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  Court also ordered defendant to pay a fine of $100.00 plus all applicable court costs by 11/14/16 or the nonpayment penalty will be entry of a civil judgment.

Court will consider motion for expungement in 1 year if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Credit received and filed.

Defendant Elijah S Gallien in court with attorney Earlean Antonia Laster.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.
Court ordered stayed warrant lifted.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Attorney Earlean Antonia Laster in court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for motion hearing. For reasons stated on the record, motion is withdrawn. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next scheduled hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
State's Brief in Opposition to Defendant's Motion to Dismiss, filed.
Brief In Support Of Motion To Dismiss Case.

Defendant Elijah S Gallien in court with attorney Earlean Antonia Laster.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing. Defense requested a motion hearing date. Defense motions are due by 10/01/2015.  Any written response of the State is due by 10/21/2015. Case adjourned to Branch 37.  Motion hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
to dismiss case from the defense recieved and filed.

Defendant Elijah S Gallien in court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Attorney Earlean Laster is ill for today's proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Elijah S Gallien in court with attorney Earlean Antonia Laster.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Status conference held off the record.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer prior to today's proceedings.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Elijah S Gallien in court with attorney Earlean Antonia Laster. Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Pre-trial conference held off the record.    Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM015197  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03/15/2015

Court ordered the remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Elijah S Gallien in court with attorney Earlean Antonia Laster.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/18/15 @ 1:30pm
